question_text: Which two actions help preserve signal integrity when working with twisted pair cabling and punchdown blocks? (Select two)
answer_options: Leaving no more than 0.5 inch of untwisted wire before termination
Running cables tightly against power conduit for reduced loop area
Using a punchdown tool to ensure secure contact
Wrapping excess cable around nearby pipes for slack
Cross-terminating wire pairs to reduce pair mismatch
correct_answer: Leaving no more than 0.5 inch of untwisted wire before termination
Using a punchdown tool to ensure secure contact
explanation: Maintaining pair twist close to termination and using proper tools preserves signal quality and ensures clean terminations.
